result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Talatzko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge and domestic abuse surcharge. All other court costs are waived.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No violent contact with significant other. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Continue counseling, therapy, AODA treatment and cognitive thinking. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED. Credit for time served only to be applied if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel Talatzko in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 & count 2; DRI count 3.
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt as to count 1 & count 2; DRI count 3.

Ct 1- Withheld sentence, 2 Years Probation

Ct 2- Withheld sentence, 2 Years Probation

Conditions:
90 days RCJ - Stayed
Credit for time served to be applied only if revoked
No drugs, no alcohol
No violent contact with significant other
Continue counseling & therapy, AODA treatment & cognitive thinking
Do not drive unless properly licensed
20 Hours of community service work 
$100 domestice violence assesstment both counts + waive other court costs
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge on count 1

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel Talatzko
Current: 3201 Charles St, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 10-09-2015)
Prior: 3343 S 14th, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    No contact with the victim KK (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  BOND AMENDED:    No violent contact.  Defendant may not reside in the home at this time.  Judge needs to see that the defendant in a program to handle alcohol abuse at this time.  There has to be a commitment to sobriety.
10/09/15 - BOND AMENDED TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO LIVE WITH VICTIM
